Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu was elected President once again.
At the Ordinary Grand Congress, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu was re-elected as the general president.
Kılıçdaroğlu, who received the votes of 990 out of 1,238 delegates who cast their votes, got re-elected as the president.
Two hundred and forty eight votes were declared invalid.
After the results were announced, the party members made a demonstration of joy.
The CHP had a total of 1,275 delegates.
The congress completed its work and adjourned to meet on Sunday at 10 a.m.
Kılıçdaroğlu said the following in summary at the party congress:
Here we would want to play games, to sing folk songs.
But the point we have reached is not very encouraging.
There is a grim reality of managing Turkey.
The atmosphere created by these overshadows all of them.
The reason for the gloomy picture is the people who govern the country.
As the Republican People's Party we are against the terrorism, no matter where and how it comes from.
Terrorism is a crime against humanity and must never be forgiven.
The struggle against terror is done with wisdom, knowledge, and enlightenment.
Of course, let us struggle, we do not want anyone's nose to bleed.
What is the difference between the photos taken in Syria and Lebanon and the ones taken in the Southeast?
While they were sitting at the table they made some serious mistakes.
The blood that flows, the tears that are shed, all are responsible for the dead is the ruling party.
They took over the country with zero terrorism in 2002, today there is a Turkey in a blood bath.
Who is responsible for these?
Are you Şehmuz, the taxi driver in Diyarbakır?
What is Turkey paying the price for?
We will attend meetings in good faith on changing the coup laws and we will convey our thoughts.
We will not allow a country to be built on anyone's personal views.
"Let's change the mindset of the coup plotters" I say.
Because of the fact that the intellectuals of this country have expressed their thoughts, their homes are being raided at dawn, and they are being taken into custody.
There are aspects that we do not agree on, but people should be able to express their ideas freely.
This dictator says, "Eat the country's bread and act as an enemy to the state".
I want to ask him too, why don't those who eat the state's bread, use all of the state's facilities, think about ripping off the state?
CHP is the party that brought the biggest changes to this country.
We will prepare for the fourth great revolution together.
We will bring liberal democracy to this country at all costs.
They can arrest us, or put us in custody, whatever they do, whatever the price is, we will bring freedom to this country.
I am making a clear and open call to you, Davutoglu.
Hiding behind the law of coup is not a way to get rid of the coup mentality.
You have given a medal for superior service to the man who threatened you.
What coup are you talking about?
It is completely for fooling people.

Party officials listed the other 3 revolutions as follows: 1. The great revolution is the end of the monarchy and the establishment of the republic; 2. The great revolution is the transition from the one-party period to the multiparty period during İnönü; 3. The revolution is to move to social democracy with Bülent Ecevit...
The president has qualifications, responsibilities.
Article 103 states that the president swears an oath.
We know how important the concepts of honor and dignity are in this society.
If a man comes out and gives this word, he will make it happen to the death.
Because honor and dignity is not to be discussed for us.
What are honor and dignity to you, you scavenger of a dictator!
What do you understand from honor and dignity? Why did you make this oath?
What does honour and dignity mean to you?
I want to learn this.
A religious man has a conception of honor.
Their intention is not to abolish martial law, but to legalize it.
And that's not enough, they want a presidential system.
How could it be a presidential system; it is a presidential system of patronage.
Why are you rejecting the parliament system of the Ottoman Empire?
One person can command others to do whatever is necessary.
Is the parliamentary system working well in Turkey?
No, it is not working.
If we bring libertarian democracy, the system works.
They say a coup, but they've strengthened the rule of law.
İzmir MP Mustafa Balbay announced his candidacy for the presidency, but he could not enter the race because he could not get the endorsement of the 128 delegates necessary to be nominated.
Balbay, who was able to collect 92 signatures, said, "I cannot be a candidate under these conditions."

While there are seats reserved for members of the party assembly (PM), executive committee (MYK) and honor committee in the assembly hall, it attracted attention that former CHP leader Deniz Baykal sat with his party members in the stands.
Istanbul MP Gülay Yedekçi, on the other hand, sat next to the spot reserved for CHP leader Kılıçdaroğlu instead of sitting in the area assigned for deputies by arriving early.
The meeting between Muharrem İnce and Kılıçdaroğlu was one of the issues discussed behind the scenes of the congress.
Ince, who declined the offer of the PM membership, made it clear that he also declined it.
However, there were claims from the party headquarters that the request was not from Ince, and he was not nominated for the position of PM.
İnce tweeted “Nobody can learn the content of the meeting from the Istanbul MP Ali Özcan.
Özcan also said, "How could I know of a conversation between two people."
He just said "gone, seen".
Kılıçdaroğlu often called for his father to clap.
The first day of the ordinary "Democracy, Change and Fraternity Party Convention" was marked by the PM gossip.
After his speech at the congress, Kılıçdaroğlu began working on the PM list at his house.

It is learned that Kılıçdaroğlu, who is preparing a 100-people key list, called 13 MYK members except Yakup Akkaya, Sencer Ayata, Ercan Karakaş, who said they do not want to take part in the administration, and Seyhan Erdoğdu, who once again applied to PM, and told them that they will be included in the list.
It is indicated that Kılıçdaroğlu might point to another list which is a shrunken list which consists of 100 people in addition to the PM key list.

The 21-point conclusion statement, which was accepted unanimously at CHP's convention, demands that the objections to the European Charter of Local Self-Government, which came to the agenda with the autonomy discussions of the DTP, be lifted and the share of power at local governments be increased.
The declaration also includes the objectives of eliminating the party-state system and establishing a transparent and accountable legal state.
The congress was observed by AK Party's Deputy Chairman Selçuk Özdağ, HDP's Idris Baluken, and MHP's Ruhsar Demirel.
MHP deputy Özdağ and the AK Party delegation left the room due to Kılıçdaroğlu's harsh criticism of President Erdoğan.
Özdağ said, "When I realized that the criticism was going too far, I could not accept it."

The hall featured a banner with the photos of two detained journalists, Can Dündar and Erdem Gül, reading, "If you don't burn, if I don't burn, how will the darkness turn into light?" and Kurdish, Turkish, and English-language banners reading "Peace."
The congress began with Grup Yorum and Ahmet Kaya songs in the morning.
The message sent to the meeting by Türkan Elçi, the wife of Diyarbakır Bar President Tahir Elçi, who lost his life in an armed attack, was greeted with great applause. (I'm not sure about this one.)
Berkin Elvan's mother Gülsüm and his father Sami Elvan also joined the kurultay.
The segment where Kılıçdaroğlu said, whatever the cost, they will stand by democracy to the death, was the most clapped segment of his speech.
The CHP, which has brought together 52 congresses, of which 34 are ordinary and 18 are extraordinary, held its 53rd great congress yesterday in Ankara Arena.
Participation was high.
There were more than 15,000 CHP members in the 12,000-seat hall.
But there was no enthusiasm, as if the crowd was giving its right to the right.
The most exciting moment was when Kilicdaroglu walked into the hall with his wife Selvi Kilicdaroglu.
The excitement continued as the Kılıçdaroğlu couple greeted the guests in the salon.
There was no sign of the discipline, seen in AKP congresses, in the hall.
Even while Kilicdaroglu was speaking, there was a lot of activity in the open area at the field part of the Arena.
Apparently, CHP'liers who wanted to enter the Party Assembly preferred to support themselves by informing party executives and journalists about themselves.
A CHP official tried to explain that it was not a bad thing, saying, "It's better than the party meetings in Korea or the Soviet Union where party members sit like puppets in a row."
There is one more difference between the CHP congress and the AKP or MHP congresses.
At these parties, only the general presidents speak.
In CHP, the party congress becomes a platform where party problems are also discussed.
The Chairperson of the Council had trouble controlling the time yesterday as a large number of party members wanted to make speeches at the congress.

While there were opinions that "the country is going downhill" and "you will change the state of affairs with the picture you will create in this hall," there was also some distance from the "the country is going downhill" expression.
While all CHP members said, "Let's do something," there was no consistent or strong response to the question, "What should we do?"
The fact that no elections will be held in the next 4 years had a big effect on the voting.
When Kılıçdaroğlu got on the stage, we reporters also waited to see what answer he would give to the question of "What should we do".
Kılıçdaroğlu first answered the question of "What's going on?"

He drew attention to the issue of imprisoned journalists, to those who have been attacked for signing the declaration, to what happened in the Southeast, and to the impasse that the foreign policy has entered.
Regarding the CHP, he gave long responses to the "Anatolian legends" such as "it is an atheist party", "it supports coups", "it is the party of the elitists".
When it came to the question of "what to do", he tried to put forward a "strategy", rather than concrete steps.
He emphasized that all these problems can be overcome with stronger democracy and more justice.
He also promised on behalf of the CHP and said, "We will work as long as it takes to bring democracy."
He said that "We will fight for democracy to the death".
One last note; it should be recalled that CHP has overcome the organizational issues with the 53rd convention, and it can now hold conventions without any problems.
For the 900 journalists who were said to be following the Congress, cards had been printed, but the journalist participation in the hall was not at that level.
The Ankara representatives of the media organizations were also not as enthusiastic about following the congress as they were at the convention of the AK Party.
Life sentence was demanded for self-rule
The indictment prepared by the Diyarbakır Chief Public Prosecutor's Office regarding 7 defendants, 3 of whom were in prison, was accepted by the 4th High Criminal Court.

In the indictment, it is stated that declarations were made in some districts and neighborhoods of Diyarbakır, Istanbul, Şırnak, Mardin, Muş, Hakkari, Siirt, Bitlis, Batman, Van and Ağrı under the name of "self-governance" upon the orders and calls of the senior administrators of the PKK/KCK terrorist organization.

The indictment, which states that calls for illegal actions were made to the youth and women structures of the organization from the heads of the organization, records that there was an increase in bomb, long-barreled firearms and rocket launcher attacks against security forces, public institutions and organizations, and the residences, workplaces and vehicles of citizens.
ISIS fighters fought against the opposition, our police station was shot.

The clashes between the Conquest Army, which has been established by ISIS and the opposition groups that have come together in the Black Mezra Bigiddin and Kara Köprülü Village of Syria across from Yavuzlu Village of Kilis, have been getting more intense as the days go by.
The sound of the weapons and the shells fired during the clashes between ISIL and the opposition near the border is also heard from Turkey.
While smoke rising from the regions that explosions frequently occur in could be seen by naked eye by Turkey, security forces took intense measure with armoured vehicles at the border.
On the other hand, Harassment fire was opened from the village of Bidin, under ISIL control, to the frontier guard station of Sehit Mehmet close to the village of Yavuzlu in Kilis.
In response, the soldiers, as part of the engagement rules, fired artillery and heavy weapons at the area where the firing had come from.
Russian warplanes are reported to have carried out an attack on the village of Hameyin, 17 kilometres from the Turkish border.
Six Syrians, who were injured in the air bombardment, were brought to Kilis State Hospital for treatment by their relatives.

iOS9: how to get the new iPhone operating system, Apple update released
For the new operating system, you can go to the Settings application, touch "General", and select "Software Update".
When ready, your phone will offer you the options to download and install.
Some users experienced a problem after this installation and they received an error message saying "Software update failed".
It is recommended for users to wait for a decrease in uploading to the system or try with iTunes and try to upgrade from there.
The phone will guide you through the rest of the process.

You might be able to clear some room by deleting apps - but Apple has thwarted this by shrinking the update and offering to delete some apps, then using a special tool to reinstall them when the process is done.
While the update continues, it is worth making sure that your phone is charged or that you are near a charging device.
Apple does not let you update if the charge is too low because the phone can stop midway through the update.

At the same time, you should make sure will have done everything you can to prepare for it before downloading. If something goes wrong, you should try to stop it and protect yourself. iOS 9 comes with new features that speed up and fix the operating system, such as smarter personal assistant and new production features for iPad, along with many other new features.
FedEx's revenues are mixed and financial outlook for 2016 is down

FedEx reported disappointing results for the past three months and the cargo giant has lowered its full-year profit forecast due to a decline in demand for its shipping services and higher costs for its ground operations.
The company also said that it plans to hire approximately 55,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
In this time last year, FedEx announced that it would hire 50,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
Before the opening, at the pre-opening session, the market was down approximately 2.5 percent 45 minutes before the opening gong on Wednesday.
FedEx Corp., which will end its fiscal year in May, said that it expects to earn between $10.40 and $10.90, which will be 20 cents lower than previous estimates.
Analysts expected $10.84 based on the survey made by FactSet.
Despite the average 4.9 percent increase to be effective as of January 4, and the high surcharges to be applied on heavy or large packages as of November in road transport, a decrease is likely.
According to the company, cost reductions, higher revenue and growth in e-commerce are expected to result in higher profits compared with the previous year.
President and CEO Fred Smith said that "the company delivered a solid performance in spite of particularly weak economic conditions in manufacturing and global trade."
Its holiday hiring plans were announced a day after rival UPS, which said it plans to hire the same number of extra workers as last year, 90,000 to 95,000.
FedEx made $692 million during the three-month period ending August 31, which represents a 6% increase over the same period last year.
The earnings per share came in at $2.42, which was below the $2.44 predicted by 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research.
The income increased 5 percent to 12.3 billion dollars.
Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $12.23 billion.
FedEx took a hit from a decline in priority international shipping last year, which led to a slowdown in revenue in its Express unit.
But the explosion of online shopping helped boost the results of FedEx's Ground Delivery Service.
In the last quarter, revenue from site services increased by 29 percent, but operating income was basically stagnant due to high costs in the large packages and internal insurance.
While revenues in the freight division fell due to high labor costs, the express unit saw high revenues due to high base rates.
In pre-market trading, about an hour before the opening bell, FedEx shares were down 3.85 or 2.5% to 150.15.
They closed on Tuesday at 11 percent below the year's highs, hit on June 11, and 17 percent below the record levels.

After one of the most anticipated meetings in years, Federal Reserve policymakers spent two days huddled around a 27-foot conference table in Honduras this week, almost on the tenth anniversary of the last time, to decide whether it was time to raise interest rates.
The two-storey meeting room on one wing of the central bank will feature a mural of the United States.
A reminder from Ms. Yellen and her colleagues that the Fed’s first priority is the nation’s economic interests.
The Federal Reserve has two mandates from Congress: to maximize American employment and to keep the prices here stable.
But since the Great Depression, Fed leaders have accepted a third, unwritten mandate: financial stability.

And this third proxy, the X factor in Thursday's forecast of the near-unpredictable decision on whether the US economy is ready to start weaning itself off the unique stimulus support of near-zero short-term interest rates since late 2008

While most data show a solid expansion of the data economy, the latest turmoil in global financial markets could make already cautious Fed officials jittery about adding vulnerability by raising the benchmark federal funds rate, even by a quarter of a percentage point or less.
"The labor market and inflation will be the first and most important thing to watch," Stifel Nicolaus & Co chief economist Lindsey M. Piegza said.
But if they are looking for an excuse not to raise it, he said, the increasing uncertainty surrounding the global marketplace should give them enough reason to wait a bit longer.
There is no consensus about what the Fed will do, and this is causing fluctuations in the financial markets on its own.
Recently, half of the economists interviewed by Bloomberg were expecting a rate hike this week.
Meanwhile, the financial markets are expecting the Fed to wait with its main indicator showing only a roughly 30 percent chance of a hike.
If the Fed raises the rate, this could signal a drop in the stock market, if the policy makers do not take the edge off by promising another increase.
On Tuesday, Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 228.89 points, or 1.4 percent, to 16,599.85.
John Lonski, Chief Economist, Moody's Capital Markets Research Group, said, "The uptick was sparked by expectations that Fed policy makers will leave rates unchanged this week."
"It would be a surprise if the Fed were to raise rates now," he said.
If the Fed had not made this decision, "it would have taken them a year to calm the financial markets, so they would not panic."
Other experts have argued that a rate increase could calm financial markets by lifting the curtain of uncertainty on when the Fed will act.
Just a month ago, the Fed looked as if it was set to raise rates by a quarter point this month, a small step that would tighten money conditions gradually and help reinforce the U.S. recovery.
Yellen, despite complaints from liberals about the need for a more economic process, said she expected the rate increase in the spring and at the beginning of summer.
While the rate of job creation decreased in August, growth in the labor market remained steady this year.
The unemployment rate last month fell to 5.1%, its lowest level in seven years, and is approaching the level the Fed considers full employment.
Salary increases showed signs of improvement.
And even though inflation remained below the Fed's annual 2% target, Fed policymakers said a sharp drop in oil prices was a significant reason.
Pantheon Macroeconomics chief economist Ian Shepherdson said the economy "can cope with higher rates and needs them despite the tightness in the labor market."
But all financial markets in the world have been shaken after the devaluation of the Chinese currency at the end of last month.
The Dow Jones industrial average fell to 16 percent below its record level in May, reflecting investors' fears that a slowing Chinese economy will drag down global growth.
As the market neared a 10 percent decline from its high in May, the Dow bounced back.
Market turbulence makes it harder for Fed policy makers to calculate when they will lift interest rates.

Stephen D. Oliner, senior research fellow at UCLA's Ziman Center for Real Estate and a former Fed staffer, said the committee could be "a little bit more dovish" because of the uncertainty surrounding China's financial markets, and with a lack of news about the economic slowdown.
Now they estimate that they will at least wait one more month in order to manage the effects better.
"There's a lot of uncertainty about the effects on the US economy, and they have almost no data to pin their hopes on a Chinese recovery," Oliner said.
The health of the global economy is not one of the Fed's top concerns, so the process shouldn't be a factor technically in the blackouts.
But in reality, the Fed became the global monetary authority.
The impact of the central bank has been very big in the recent years.
The only hint so far from the Fed's Chairman Ben S. Bernanke is that it will "slow" the expansion of global market jitters triggered by the Fed in 2013.

In a world where markets and economies are increasingly intertwined, we might expect the Fed officials to not only follow what's happening elsewhere, but also to consult with other central bank officials and experts to read the global economy better.
Zachary Karabell, the chief global strategist at asset management firm Envestnet Inc., said the decision-making process is "more art than science."

Jeffrey Lacker, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, Va., noted this month that the Fed “has reacted too aggressively to financial market developments that are not clearly connected to economic fundamentals in the past.”

Lacker, a voting member of the policy-setting Federal Open Market Committee, cited the Fed's moves in 1998-99 as an example of how the central bank can tighten credit without tipping the economy into a recession.
"Despite limited advice on US growth, the Asian financial crisis caused the Fed to cut key rates by three-quarters of a percentage point over three meetings," Lacker said.
A year later, Fed officials restored these cuts.
"The Fed should only make financial balance considerations a priority during big crises, like in 2008," said Adam S. Posen, a former member of the UK Monetary Policy Committee.
He said the recent turmoil doesn't come close to that level.
You wouldn't really want to increase rates when markets are in a nervous state, said Peterson, head of the Peterson Institute for International Economics.
The federal reserve act still has two remits and does not talk about a financial balance and until that changes, I don't think they should take any action in that direction.
Do you want a wonderful market in Thailand?
Try LAX-C in the China town.
Yes, it is Chinatown.
The Market/Depo was opened in 1997 and belongs to LAX-C Inc.
LAX-C is the wholesale Thai market that sells to the public, which is also frequently referred to as Thai Costco.
Yes, that's Chinatown, not Taiwan town.
The market/warehouse is a single-stop shop for a wide variety of fresh, frozen, and dried foods, popular Asian and Thai snacks, kitchenware, furniture, religious and holiday decorations.
If you want to buy some engine oil, there is also a car section.
The shop is huge, and going all around it takes hours.
If you get hungry from all the shopping, pick up some food from LAX-C BBQ Express.
The inside food part is next to the (good, price-wise) cashiers, and has various take-out options.
What's in store: Do you want something Thai?
She's probably in LAX-C.
The goods are reasonably priced and some are sold in bulk.

Among the fresh produce you'll find special Asian and regional Thai herbs, fruits and more.
## Word order
The meat counter is extensive and so is the fish -- the workers back there will clean and fillet the fish and they'll even fry it for you if you like.

The store has a large frozen section; there you will find frozen kaffir lime leaves, bitter melon and galangal, whole ducks, fish and beef blood, fish balls, regional sausages, commercial foods, and more.
Who shops here: restaurant owners and chefs, families, individuals.
There are both shopping carts and forklifts in the wide corridors.
Fresh monthong durian stand is next to the exit stand.
Where: Between the Chinatown section and downtown Los Angeles, in the industrial section of town, a few blocks away from Philippe The Original.
Parking: LAX-C has its own parking lot that it shares with other stores and restaurants.
Even though the store is very crowded, finding a parking place is not usually difficult.
The Rio Grande Pediatric Society of Brazil is promoting healthy nutrition during breastfeeding.

The Brazilian pediatric organization SPRS resorted to a shocking method by including the milk boy pictures drawn with unhealthy food representations to try and explain the importance of healthy nutrition in women during their breastfeeding process.
Human milk consists of many kinds of protein, fat, vitamins and carbohydrates that provide all the necessary nutrients for infants to develop a healthy immunity system.
Due to the additional energy requirements of being pregnant and nursing, it is recommended that pregnant women and new mothers raise their daily caloric intake to around 500 calories.
However, according to new research, the food supplement mothers should take is not limited to caloric intake.

A new study led by Baylor College of Medicine Professor Robert Waterland concludes that healthy diet of pregnant women may protect their babies from developing tumours by influencing their genetic expression.
Unfortunately, it has been determined that unhealthy eating negatively affects the child's immune system.

Until today in September, Sunrise's average is 349,000, compared with 314,000 for Today.
This is the most curious thing that happens every morning.
The winds of change are affecting the people more than the parliament this morning!
Karl and Lisa are good, thank you for asking!

The final three think Sam Wood is the perfect man, but who will he choose?
Did we find the secret? ...
Lana Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay, and Snezana Markoski may have revealed who will win The Bachelor without knowing it.
The woman to be chosen by Sam Wood at the end of the Bachelor program was kept in a big secret.
And the three remaining girls are doing everything they can to prevent the others from finding out who gets the last rose.
However, if we check on the three girls before they are reduced to two, Lan Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay and Snezana Markoski, they may have unknowingly given a clue as to who will win.
Sam Wood sealed his lips until Thursday's finale.
All three women sang the praises of Wood in lyrical terms, explaining why his sense of humor, his drive, his family values and his positive attitude make him the partner they want.
But their answer to the question "If it's not you, who picks Wood's last rose?" may contain some information about who will win The Bachelor's heart.
Both Jeavons-Fellows and Markoski quickly named Mackay as the best option other than themselves.
Sarah Mackay and Sam Wood have been pretty close from day one.
Jeavons-Fellows said: "From the moment I met them, I felt that they were a good match and they had good energy and I thought that throughout the program."
Markoski adds, “Sarah is very practical and it is very fun to be around her.”
I saw them together and there was a chemistry between them.
They feel very comfortable and at ease when they are side by side.
Sarah Mackay thinks that Sam Wood and she will be a good couple.
Mackay said last week's home visit appointments made him think that Wood was “the right person”.
"I realized that it was definitely not just a game when I saw it with my friends and family - I am now hooked on it," he said.
When he was asked who he would choose if he could not have Wood, he was mysterious.
"I don't know if I can say that" he said.
"I love the other girls equally - Snezana and Lana equally."
The Bachelor is on Ten channel on Wednesdays at 19.30.
First aired: Could Sarah be the best choice for Sam Wood?
Jarryd Hayne had a plethora of options in terms of where he would start his NFL career.
Detroit and Seattle showed much interest after he moved to the US and many other teams approached him after last year's impressive open training day.
But he chose the San Francisco 49ers and coach Jim Tomsula and it looks like it was a very wise decision.
Some coaches, like in the 20-3 defeat to Minnesota on Tuesday, will bench Hayne for his drop in performance in the Australian rugby league.
But Tomsula believed in him and gave Hayne another chance by including him in a game after Reggie Bush's injury.
Tomsula continued to show his true colors in the locker room after the game.
Instead of humiliating the rookies in front of the whole team, he encouraged them.
Tomzula also supported Hayne openly during the post-match press conference.
49ers reporter Cam Inman says Hayne also got encouragement from special teams coordinator Thomas McGaughey, who told him to forget that play and get ready for the next one.
Jarryd Hayne caused Minnesota Vikings to score in the first quarter, and he fumbled the ball.
It was not the way Hayne and his broad Australian fan base had imagined his first NFL game would go.

Hayne was seen swearing after dropping the ball and fumbling out of the field later, and he said to the Australian radio duo Hamish and Andy on 104.1 2DayFM that he can't imagine a worse start to his NFL career.
Hayne said, "That was just one of those things, you're going to get upset and then you move on to the next play."

Four people died in Nepal due to policemen firing plastic bullets at the protesters.
Four people, including a four-year-old boy, died when police fired plastic bullets at a crowd protesting against the proposed new constitution in the country, an official said on Wednesday.
The incident occurred Tuesday evening in the city of Rupandehi, 175 miles west of the capital, Katmandu.
District Chief Bishnu Prasad Dhakal said more than 1,000 protesters had gathered outside a police station and that some threw stones and petrol bombs.
Mr. Dhakal said the police used pepper spray and fired in the air before using the plastic bullets.
He said that twenty police officers and five civilians were injured.
It is not clear why the plastic bullets, which are known to kill but used more often as a less lethal alternative, resulted in such a high death rate.

The clashes were the latest in weeks of violent protests across southern Nepal, where members of the Madhesi ethnic group say the proposed new constitution will dilute their political influence in the regions they live.
The ethnic Tharus group, which wants to set up its own state, held protests in western Nepal.
At least 40 people, including 11 police officers, have died in the violent clashes that have been ongoing since August 10.

Four major political parties had agreed - an important but potentially unsettling step toward drafting a new constitution for Nepal, which had been ruled for centuries by a central government - to divide the country into regions.
Work on a new constitution had been under way since 2008, but lawmakers accelerated the process following the devastating earthquake in April that killed thousands of people.
Lawmakers have been working on the draft constitution in Katmandu this week and officials said the new text would be ready by Sunday.
The NHC says there is a 60% chance of a hurricane in the South of Cape Verde Islands.

The U.S. National Hurricane Center said Monday that a broad low-pressure system several hundred miles (kilometers) southwest of the southern Cape Verde Islands has a 60 percent chance of becoming a tropical cyclone in the next 48 hours.

Another well-defined low-pressure system is noted between Cape Verde Islands and the Leeward Islands, and Miami-based National Hurricane Center says that the system has 60% chance of becoming a tropical cyclone in the next two days.

I was lucky.

Europe stands at its worst refugee crisis since the Second World War, the biggest reason being the four-year war in Syria that has displaced over 4 million people this year.
People are also fleeing war-torn Afghanistan, Yemen, Iraq and Libya.

Bariatric surgery may be helpful for diabetes patients who are moderately obese
According to a new study, the benefits of obesity surgery for moderate-obese patients with type 2 diabetes may not be seen for at least five years.
However, it is still too early to say if moderately obese diabetics live longer after weight-loss surgery than diabetics who do not undergo surgery for obesity.
According to Dr. Robin Blackstone, who wrote the article on the new study on JAMA surgery and is an expert on obesity surgery, "it takes a long time for death rates to emerge."
Weight loss surgeries, also known as bariatric surgery, use various methods to reduce the stomach size.
These suppress hunger and restrict the body's ability to digest food.
Over the years, bariatric surgery has been proven effective in treating type 2 diabetes, but most of the research was done on severely obese people with a body mass index (BMI) of 35 or higher.
BMI, which is measured according to the ratio of height and weight, is considered normal between 18.5 and 24.9.
A BMI of 25 or over indicates that a person is overweight, and a BMI of over 30 indicates that a person is obese.
BMI can be calculated from this link: 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv.

In the new study, Taiwan's Min-Sheng Hospital, a full-service hospital, used data from a trial that compared two types of bariatric surgery that it had used to treat moderately obese patients with type 2 diabetes since 2007 - gastric bypass and gastric banding.
By the end of the fifth year of the study, the average BMI for those who had surgery had dropped from 31 to 24.5.
In contrast, the BMI of those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatment remained around 29.
Diabetes was completely resolved in 36% of the operated ones, and partially resolved in 28%.
Diabetes has been completely and partially cured for only 1 % and 2 % of the group, respectively, receiving medical treatment.
Also, blood pressure control, triglycerides and "bad" LDL cholesterol were generally better in the surgery group, according to the authors.
The researchers also have looked at A1c hemoglobin, which reflects the percentage of hemoglobin in the blood that has been glucose-damaged over time, in the patients.
According to the researchers, keeping A1c hemoglobin below 7 is best.
After the operation, the average blood glucose A1c dropped from 9% to around 6%.
The rate of weight loss remained stable around eight percent in the group receiving medical treatment.

But the improved A1c levels and better "glucose control" they brought did not lower death rates over the five years of the study, according to Dr. Chih-Cheng Hsu and colleagues who conducted the research.
The research team compared their findings with these two types of surgery.

In the fifth year, the group who had the bypass surgery lost more weight (18.7 to 14.2 kg) than the group who had the stomach band surgery, and there was a larger decrease in BMI (7.4 to 5.1), and likewise A1c hemoglobin (%3.1 to %2.1), and the probability of the diabetes reversing entirely was higher (46.9 to 16.7).

Although the study did not show a definite survival benefit by the end of the fifth year after surgery, Dr. Blackstone from the Arizona College of Medicine-Phoenix said there is valid data from a study done in Sweden on heavier patients that the surgery extended life span.

In this study, the Swedish researchers found that the risk of death from any cause was 29 percent lower for the gastric bypass patients than for another group of obese patients who had received more conventional treatment.

Although this latest study did not show what the benefits of surgery are for these patients in terms of their survival, according to Blackstone, it is reassuring for people who are related to this issue and have a BMI of less than 35.
The most crucial part of the article is here, because it is saying that in the low-BMI group, this surgery is safe, and there was no increase in mortality risk or renal complications, he said.
Blackstone added that people and doctors should take the issue of weight gain seriously as the patients' BMI dropped to below 27 to 30.
"I think we've waited long enough for the people to take it seriously," he said.
After gathering these genetic changes that make their bodies related to obesity and diabetes in their bodies, I think it is really difficult to turn it back.

Four-fold increase in 4 years in children consuming hand sanitizer
U.S. poison control centers reported a nearly 400 percent rise in alcohol-soaked wipes ingested by children under age 12 from 2010 to 2012.
According to Dr. Gaylord Lopez, the director of the Georgia Poison Center, there were 3,266 cases in 2010, and 16,117 cases in 2014, of children under the age of 12 reported to the center.
Lopez told CNN that "kids are more attractive to these kind of products and unfortunately there are some of them in need of rescue."
Some children drink hand sanitizers knowingly, and some say they do it to impress their friends or in a social media challenge.
Videos on YouTube show teenagers drinking antiseptic for cheap thrills.
It is reported that some teenagers mix the antiseptic concoction with mouthwashes that contain alcohol in order to get a stronger kick.
Small children can be attracted to the pleasant smells of antiseptics.
Lopez said, "The kid doesn't think it's a bad thing."
Most of the more attractive ones (hand sanitizers) are scented.
Antiseptic hand gels are available in strawberry, grape and orange scents, which are very attractive to children.
Hand sanitizers contain between 45 and 95 percent alcohol, depending on how you look at it.
Particularly in small children, just a few sips of alcohol can lead to poisoning.
"It's alcohol in a high concentration," said Dr. Stephen Thornton, director of the Poison Control Center at the University of Kansas Hospital in Kansas City according to Fox 4 TV.
You wouldn't leave a few glasses of whisky lying around, but people leave these hand-sanitisers lying around and it's very easy way for children to get a lot of alcohol.
Recently, six-year-old Nhaijah Russell was rushed to the emergency room after consuming only four squirts of strawberry-scented hand sanitizer at school.
His blood alcohol level was 0.179 and according to Dr. Chris Ritchey, an emergency room doctor at Gwinnett Medical Center outside Atlanta, that level was two times the legal limit for an adult.
Nhaijah was unable to pronounce words and was unable to walk when he arrived at the emergency room.

According to Rithey, the doctors kept the girl overnight under observation in a separate children's hospital because alcohol caused the child to fall and hit her head, even though there was no sign of brain trauma.
"It was very frightening," said mother Ortoria Scott to CNN.
It could have been fatal for my child.
Lopez recommended parents and teachers to use alcohol-free products and to keep the contact between antiseptic wipes and the skin short and place them to places where children could not reach.
Except for alcohol poisoning, some antiseptics were associated with death cases.
In 2013, two women in Ontario died after ingesting hand sanitizer containing an unnamed toxic substance.
Health officials said the substance could be methyl alcohol, which is not ethyl alcohol as listed on the ingredients list, but can be fatal.

In January, three fourth-grade students from the northern part of New York, according to police reports, had planned to poison their "mean-spirited" teachers by placing an antibacterial product around the classroom.
The teacher banned the use of hand sanitizer in the classroom because she is highly allergic to it.
The police have labeled this plan as "a futile attempt" and recommended disciplinary punishment for the school administration.

Saudi Arabia did not give up on TÜBİTAK

Science, Industry, and Technology Minister Fikri Işık stated that a new agreement was made for the second sale of the Ballistics Image Analysis and Recognition System (BALISTIKA), which was developed by TÜBİTAK, to Saudi Arabia, saying, "With the agreement, which includes the development and installation of an additional 8 systems, the number of BALISTIKA systems serving in Saudi Arabia will increase to 14 from 6."
Işık commented on the BALİSTİKA, which is developed by TÜBİTAK Uzay Teknolojileri Araştırma Enstitüsü.
Işık explains that the system enables ballistic experts to eliminate their problems while they examine shotgun shells and bullet cores.
Işık said that the data gathered from different geographic locations and the accompanying information can be saved and searched together via BALLISTICS.

Calling attention to one of the most important features of the BALLISTICA system being the ability to collect and display three-dimensional data with more detail and less error, Işık emphasized that thanks to the innovations brought by the system, ballistic expert's decisions can be made quickly and the rate of success greatly increases.
BALİSTİKA was exported in the context of "SUBA-1 Project"

Stating that BALISTIKA has met all the criteria in the success criteria and has received full marks from the General Directorate of Security, Işık also noted that the system, established in 10 different regions including Ankara, covers all of Turkey.

Noting that the system has been exported abroad due to its success, Işık recalled that BALİSTİKA had been exported as part of the SUBA-1 Project, which was carried out with Saudi Arabia and the installation of it in 6 regions was successfully completed in 2013.

Işık, the CEO of BALİSTİKA, stated that BALİSTİKA had signed a new agreement for the second batch of sales to Saudi Arabia and that the agreement included the development and installation of an additional 8 systems, which would increase the number of BALİSTİKA systems that would be in service in Saudi Arabia from 6 to 14.

Beşiktaş, won 12 of its last 15 matches in the Super League.

"The one who climbs and the one who eats face-to-face"
The Beşiktaş-Mersin İdmanyurdu game pits the two teams who have scored the most and given up the most goals in this season's Süper Lig.

Mersin İdmanyurdu, which had 36 goals in its net during the 17-week period, is one of the two teams of the league who concedes the most goals together with Eskişehirspor, who occupies the last place in the table.

Technical director crisis in Mersin İdmanyurdu
Mersin İdmanyurdu, which could not complete the first half of the Super League at the place it wanted, also experienced a technical director crisis during the break.
On the day that the winter camp was set to begin at Mersin İdmanyurdu, the 48-year-old head coach left the team, which had completed the first half of the season under coach Bülent Korkmaz.
Hakan Kutlu, who replaces Korkmaz and coached the club before, will be on the bench only one day.

Mersin Idmanyurduspor, who had their extraordinary general assembly in the break and elected Hüseyin Çalışkan as the club president, reached an agreement with the coach Nurullah Sağlam after the congress, but the 50-year-old coach was only in charge of the team for 2 days.
Mersin İdmanyurdu will play Beşiktaş with no technical director on the bench, as they were not able to reach an agreement with any name since Nurullah Sağlam.

While Russia is preparing to grant "the right to do business with Russia" to Turkish companies if Russia can not find alternative ways to compensate for the services offered by Turkey, the Russian Union of Tour Operators also announced "Russian citizens are not giving up on Turkey".

The Russian Ministry of Economic Development, which calculates that severing the current economic ties with Turkey will cost Russia extra, has prepared and published a new "exceptional situations" draft for the Russian government for Turkey.

According to the draft published on the Russian Federal Register, it is envisaged that Turkish companies will be allowed to do business with Russia even if they enter the sanction area when necessary.

According to the draft, Turkish companies and corporations will be able to benefit from their products and services in cases where it would be impossible or would bring significant additional costs to obtain them from sources outside of Turkey or domestically in Russia.

The joint commission to be installed within the Russian Ministry of Economic Development, together with the other ministries, will determine which Turkish-origin goods and services will be included in this category.
So which Turkish companies will be able to work in Russia will be selected by bureaucrats and decided.
According to the same document, Russian state organizations and private companies will have to prove to the commission that they have no equivalent Turkish partners.
If the draft is approved by the Russian government, it will come into effect, and privileged Turkish companies will also establish a record in Russia.
The Russian Tour Operators Association also stated in its declaration yesterday that the Russian people were not giving up on Turkey.

In the statement, the following was included: "Despite the sales ban on tours and the advice of the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs to not go to Turkey, our citizens began to search for the formula for organizing their holidays by themselves."

In those days, our businessmen who were trying to go to Russia with the usual procedures, and our personnel from Turkish Airlines, were suffering officially at the border gates.
Turkish goods are being dragged through customs and subjected to unimaginable controls.
It is not very long since then, and yesterday, Nerdun Hacıoğlu informed us from Moscow.
One way or another, sanctions are softening.
But why?
The reason is simple.

It does not make sense to shut your borders with the methods of a century ago in an age in which the economy has gotten so globalized; your efforts to turn political arguments into economic wars are also pointless.
Look, we are still writing about how the economic embargo imposed on Iran for years has been penetrated.
Two neighboring countries that seem to be great friends, but are not really, Russia and Turkey are actually in need of each other.
On such a night, it is technically impossible to separate these two countries, which meet with their businessmen and tourists, entrepreneurs and customers.

The Serbian man was released on $200,000 bail for drug charges
The man caught on the 40 kilograms of cocaine smuggled into Queensland was released on bail for the equivalent of 200,000 dollars, and he is facing a possible life in prison sentence.

Marko Maksimovic, 29, was among five people arrested last month by federal police tracking 100 kilograms of cocaine from the Solay yacht, which had been docked in Coomera since August, from Vanuatu through South America.
Maksimovic was seen at the marina in the morning with his co-conspirators and later met them at the Coomera Roadhouse where police found $40,000 worth of drugs in the glovebox of a Toyota Echo.

Despite the possibility of a potential life sentence for possession of commercial amount of cocaine, the defender's lawyer said that there is no evidence that Maksimovic tried to get all the drugs and that he could be in the cafe with an innocent intent.
The High Court Judge Peter Flanagan was concerned that Maximovic was a flight risk.
It has close ties to Serbia.
He testified in court on Wednesday that he was a frequent visitor to Serbia.
He lied to the police about where he had been during the public trial.
Maksimovic's mother and stepfather offered $200,000 between them as bail.
Judge Flanagan said, "After reading their sworn statements, it is clear that the $200,000 bail bond represents a real financial burden on them".
But he also warned that this was not enough to deter him from going to court.
Maksimovic, who was released on bail in return for him giving up both his Australian and Serbian passports and obeying a curfew between 6 pm and 6 am, reports to the police station every day.
Stevan Hogg used the girl's phone to tempt paedophiles to send images.
A pedophile used an 11-year-old girl's phone to ask for child abuse images.

Stevan Hogg, took his daughter's phone while she was asleep, and by logging into an instant messaging service as another user, he obtained a series of indecent images of children sent by a third party.
The girl later woke up and noticed that her phone was gone and found it in Hogg's hand while he was sleeping.
He saw it and noticed the disturbing messages, before he could alert his mother.
Police became involved and saw five images and analyzed the computers at the address, discovering "related" web searches for terms used to find indecent images of children.
Hogg later told officers that he did it because he wanted to 'manage the pedophiles' online and 'act like the police and scare them'.
Financial agent Eilidh Robertson told Dundee Sheriff Court: "She said it was an addiction - a very frightening one."
He admitted to making the searches on a computer, but said he did so to act like a police officer in order to frighten the pedophiles.
He was asked about the contact he had with the unknown person who sent him the pictures and his request that the person send him more.
He said that he did this to attract them.
He told that he got sick ideas after he had drink and wanted to watch rape and murder scenes.
Mrs. Robertson added: "When she found the messages on her daughter's phone, she was screaming and shouting at her mother and shaking and crying."
The mother saw the inappropriate pictures on the phone and accusations came after.
The girl was questioned and she said that she used computer and Playstation to look younger than the defendant.

Hogg, 23, of Ward Road, Dundee, was found guilty last year of taking or making indecent photographs of children on June 14 and breaching bail on January 25 this year and failing to appear in court on March 24 this year.
The defense lawyer Gregor Sim said the charges against Hogg should not be included under sex crimes, as it could be argued that there was no "obvious sexual element" to the crime.
Sheriff Alistair Carmichael has deferred the case until a social work report is available in October.
Hogg was bailed in this case but detained in custody for other outstanding cases.
Sexual crime records were made prior to the sentence date.
Robert Mugabe made an incorrect speech in the parliament in Zimbabwe.
The oldest leader in Africa, Mr. Mugabe, fell down the stairs while descending from a podium at the beginning of this year.
He was not hurt, but the video of the enemy's attack went viral on social media.
The opening of parliament was marred by allegations that opposition MPs had received anonymous death threats if they booed President Mugabe's speech.
Last month he was booed and constantly interrupted by deputies in parliament as he addressed the nation in a televised speech - he has now repeated the speech on Tuesday.
Innocent Gonese, leader of the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC), said that seven opposition politicians had received text messages not to disturb the president while he spoke.
"After Mr. Mugabe's speech, a message came to the journalists from a phone number that doesn't appear but the subject is 'death,' " he said.
He says that the immunity of the members is valid inside the parliament and that the immunity does not work when they are outside of the parliament.
Spokesman Thabani Mpofu said their party was "concerned" about threats against politicians from the party led by Morgan Tsvangirai.
Hewlett-Packard will cut 30,000 jobs.
Hewlett-Packard will cut between 25,000 and 30,000 jobs as part of a restructuring effort and cost-cutting moves in its corporate services business.
HP will split into two companies in the coming year: one for the slower-growing computer and printer operations, and the other for faster-growing hardware and services operations.
HP said in a statement that the expected job cuts would result in a cost of about $2.7 billion by the start of the fourth quarter.

Meg Whitman, chairman and CEO of HP, who will head the new unit following the split, said, "These restructuring activities will result in a more competitive and sustainable cost structure for the new Hewlett Packard Enterprise company."
"Whitman said that HP would be smaller and more focused than it is now, and would have a broad and deep portfolio to help companies move to the new style of doing business.
As a separate company, we are in a better position to serve our customers around the world as their needs evolve.
According to a statement from the company, HP's annual revenue will exceed 50 billion dollars and the company will focus on providing "unrivaled integrated technology solutions" to businesses.

They split the company, based in garages in Palo Alto, California, founded in the 1930s by Stanford University graduates Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard to make electrical equipment, into two parts called "the birthplace of Silicon Valley."
HP is undergoing a major restructuring to cope with the transition from traditional PCs to mobile devices.

The move by HP, the world's largest PC maker and one of the largest technology companies in the United States, is one of the latest moves in the sector, based on the belief that focused companies perform better.
Arsenal captain Mikel Arteta says his team-mates are having problems because of Jack Wilshere's injury before the match against Dinamo Zagreb.

This is the 10th tremor Zagreb has experienced this year.

Wenger believes Arsenal has learned the lesson from last season's loss to Monaco in the Champions League, and he continues to motivate the team with the distant goal of bringing the club its first European Cup victory.
Wenger says, "This motivation is enormous."
That had never happened at Arsenal.
We were close in 2006 but then again I am experienced enough to be realistic.
We are passionate, but not dreamers.
FriendsFest: Comedy series teaching us serious lessons about male friendship
The absence of similar programs is striking; especially when one considers that men need to open up more, and that the suicide rates are at 15% in such a period, especially among young men.
In 2013, it was the biggest cause of death for men aged 20-45; and it was three times as common in men as in women.
To bring attention to this issue, the Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) declared 2015 “The Year of the Man” and aims to counter the culture of men not asking for help when they need it.
In the center of the struggle to accomplish this difficult task is the friendship.

A study of over two thousand high school students who exhibited symptoms of depression found that if a person suffering from this problem had a high number of "healthy-minded" friends, their chances of recovering doubled.
Similarly, for those who aren't depressed, a circle of mentally healthy friends halves the risk of mental trouble.
But of course, in order for the friendship to be useful, it has to be accessible first.
In this era of social media, where communications are increasingly focused on style over substance, and where meaningful dialogue is being replaced by immediate responses,
Our digital lives have doubled the need to look strong, fun and successful, even though isolation is at the heart of everything.

Because of the dominance of extrinsically-oriented concepts such as money, fame, and social status, which are called artificial success by psychologists, we spent our intrinsic values, which have more profound impacts on our mental health, such as personal development and our intrinsic desire for friendship.
As a billionaire video-game creator recently pointed out, money does not buy more happiness.
The beauty of Friends was that it turned this focus on its head.
The characters were defined not by their jobs, but by their personalities, and they revealed this through their interactions with their friends.

Joey and Chandler's frequent hugs, the moments when they watched football in cozy armchairs, Ross' relationship with Rachel, while they were all in the background in terms of explaining the feelings of men, they were actually aware that they could relate to them.
The following are what was told to me by a helpful employee: “… through listening to depressed and suicidal people, I saw how the smallest interactions among friends could make a difference.”
Many of the men who contact us have problems talking to their friends.
"The feeling of 'just getting by' is very strong, and the idea that opening up to others is a sign of weakness."
One of the programs that comes to mind when I propose long-term coping mechanisms is the Friends series.
He brought small moments of male friendship to the fore.
In line with my goal, being a stranger on the phone helps people in times of need; but long-term support comes from close personal networks of family and friends.

And if you join the FriendsFest at Comedy Central this weekend; why not take your friends to the Central Perk for a drink in this beautiful environment where the stages have been redesigned to celebrate?
Or better yet, smile and say hello if you see someone alone in Starbucks.
You never know how your friendship can make a difference.
Friends, Comedy Central is broadcasting all 236 episodes - from start to finish - for the #FriendsFest.

Glencore raised $2.5 billion from the sale of shares
Swiss-based Glencore, which took a hit from falling prices of processed materials, raised 2.5 billion dollars by selling shares on Wednesday as part of its plan to cut debt.
Glencore, which is listed in London, announced that it sold shares worth 1.6 billion pounds to pay down its debt.

The company, which has lost 57% of its market value this year, has been significantly affected by the fall in commodity prices, which is caused by China's slowdown in economy and a lack of clarity in the markets.
The problem of rights has caused Glencore's shares to rise in London stock exchange early on Wednesday morning.
The shares rose 0.69 percent to 131.60 pence in the FTSE 100 index after a 2.77 percent rise.
Glencore said last week it was planning to sell a 2.5 billion dollar stake as part of plans to cut its 30 billion dollar debt pile by a third.
The company sold its new bonds at 125 pence per share, a 2.4 percent discount to Tuesday's closing price.
The group sold 1.3 billion shares, equivalent to 9.99 percent.
Worries about China's long-term pause in growth have slashed iron ore prices by roughly half while coal, copper and other commodities have fallen by between 20 and 40 per cent.
White House Confirms Xi Jinping's Visit to Washington
The White House confirmed Tuesday that Chinese President Xi Jinping will pay an official visit to the United States at the end of the month.
The visit will be the first official visit of Xi to Washington, and he will be returning the visit that Barack Obama paid to Beijing last November, according to the statement.
Following the bilateral talks between the two presidents, US President and First Lady Michelle Obama will host a dinner in honor of President Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan.

The statement also underlined that "President Xi's visit will expand U.S.-China cooperation on regional and global issues, as well as on the bilateral relationship, and will provide an opportunity for President Obama and President Xi to discuss areas of disagreement constructively."

It is expected that Xi will visit Seattle before Washington to meet with some leaders of American technology companies and then he will go to New York in September to participate in the UN General Assembly.

Obama and Xi are expected to discuss Washington's concerns about allegations that China is conducting cyber espionage and some of the other thorny issues, including China's claims of sovereignty in the South China Sea.

American Ninja Warriors crowns its first champion.
Professional rock climber and comic Isaac Caldiero became the first athlete to win the one-million dollar prize by winning the American Ninja Warrior competition on Monday night.
A contestant who completed all the stages of the obstacle course in this competition, which is in its seventh season, had never been seen before.
In the season finale, Caldiero and Geoff Britten were able to make it to the final round.
The last task was climbing up a rope that was about 20 meters long in 30 seconds.

Britten became the first person to complete the course in time, and so became the first athlete to complete the notoriously tough fourth stage of the American Ninja Warrior; however, Caldiero beat him by completing the course three seconds earlier.
After this difficult victory, Caldiero spoke to E!News about the shock of winning the big prize of 1 million dollars.

Xi wants to open the economy more to the world
On Tuesday, President Xi Jinping said the economy must become more open to the outside world in order to speed up growth, speaking to a group in charge of implementing reforms.
At the 16th Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform meeting, the President said, "China must continue to improve its opening up policies by attracting foreign investment expertise."
Xi says that by encouraging opening up and making new reforms, we will create a new area for economic growth by bringing new energy and liveliness.

The lead group adopted a series of proposals, including a negative list governing market access, relaxation of border controls, encouragement of state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to bring in private capital, and a review of the residents registration system.
According to the announcement, a negative list that defines the sectors and lines of business that are not allowed for investment will be prepared.
The system will be tested step by step, and it will be developed with trial programs.
This is a significant move, as it will give the market a bigger role in allocating resources and create a rules-based environment by opening up the market more.
The government will also loosen the controls on companies, allowing companies to run their own businesses.
This statement also indicates that China will explore new cross-border economic cooperation models in border areas and new mechanisms will be put into effect to promote regional growth.
More space will open up for private investments to open the sectors controlled by the state.
The explanation said “The government will not change its foreign investment policy and will protect the interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better service for them.”
In addition, the requirements for foreigners to obtain residence permits or "green cards" will be optimized and the application processes will be simplified.
At the meeting, it was discussed to guarantee the right of lawyers to practice and to train professional judges and prosecutors.
A statement released after the meeting said Premier Li Keqiang, and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli, also attended the meeting.

A small step for Banksy, a big step for "global"
The world premiere of "The Art of Banksy", the collection of works of the mysterious street artist Banksy, was held in Istanbul.
The exhibition, which is the product of the artist's 15 years of work and brings together 85 original works for the first time, is the first exhibition of the Global Karaköy building.
The first exhibition in Istanbul by the mysterious street artist Bansky opened yesterday at Global Karaköy (Rıhtım Avenue).
The world-famous artist, who hides his identity and uses a pseudonym, of course was not there at the opening.
We also do not know if he will come to Istanbul.
But according to Steve Lazaridas, the curator of the exhibition, Bansky is not even aware of the show.
There is no situation requiring that you obtain permission from him/her.
Because Bansky and Lazaridas, who were old friends, have gone their separate ways 12 years later.
Some of the works on display are Lazaridas's and others are from collectors.
But there are some things that Bansky followers wonder about.
What would Banksy think about the exhibition 'The Art of Banksy' which brings together 85 of his works?
How would you react to having to pay a ticket (35 TL) to enter an exhibition? What would you say if you saw the small shop that was created at the end of the 800 square meter gallery area?

Would the author who wrote the Red Balloon Girl, Cleaner, and Rose Now, which are works that call attention to the wounds in the world, protest if they were printed on canvas bags and wallets and made into necklaces?
The fact that the exhibition of an anonymous artist, who has anarchist spirit, has been transformed into such a consumeristic product is a disappointment to Banksy followers.
It's not his style at all.
But you'd better get tickets while they last!
A small exhibition for Banksy, but a big one for the globalizing world, "The Art of Banksy" can be seen until April.

The results of the Transition from Primary to Secondary Education System (TEOG) exam, which was organized by the Ministry of National Education (MEB) for eighth graders, were announced.

Weighted Common Exam Score: The scores obtained in the common exams in the related courses are multiplied by their own weight coefficients.
The weighted common exam grade is obtained by dividing the result obtained by adding the multiples by the total of the weight coefficients of the courses in each semester.
The arithmetic mean of the weighted common exam scores forms the weighted common exam score.
The scoring is out of a maximum of 700 points.

The main score for placement is the sum of the end-of-year scores for the 6th, 7th and 8th grades, and the weighted average score from the 8th grade common exam.

'I found 26 people while looking for two wrestlers.'
Mete Gümürhan's second documentary is "Young Wrestlers", which is competing for the 66th Berlin Film Festival.
It was the first Turkish documentary selected for the Generation Lplus section at the Berlin Film Festival (February 11-21).
Gumurhan, originally from Edirne, but now having a production company in the Netherlands, has explained why and how he made the documentary, which he completed in the summer of 2014.
"Young Wrestlers", which tells the story of an Amasya high school student who aims to become a world champion in wrestling, will compete in the "Generation Kplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival.
Young Wrestlers, the first Turkish documentary selected to this section, is a candidate for Crystal Bear Award.
Mete Gümürhan is a director who was born and raised in the Netherlands but is originally from Edirne.
He listened to his grandfather's Greco-Roman wrestling stories and watched matches when he came to Turkey during summer holidays as a child.
"There are not only political problems in Turkey."
I wanted to tell the world what else happened in Anatolia.
He wants to prepare a documentary project with six directors, thinking that unfortunately the wrestling, one of our national sports, is not well known.
The project yields no result, but one day a news item read in an airline magazine opens the door to another project for Gümürhan.
'We stayed at a sugar factory'
Mete Gümürhan follows the trail of that article that talks about a wrestling child of 10-11 years old, and goes to Samsun, where the family lives.
The father of the children does not give permission for the documentary to be filmed.
This is how Gümürhan overcame this difficulty, "I thought all day about what I could do.
Because the support of the Ministry of Culture could be withdrawn.
Father was talking about a boarding school in Amasya where the children would go.
I thought of going there.
When I was looking for two children, I found 26 children who were interested in wrestling.
We began shooting preparations within a week and got the permissions.
We did not even have a place to stay.
"We stayed in the dormitory of the sugar factory."
The biggest problem of the director of the documentary, which was completed in three weeks, was the language.
Gumurhan, who worked with a foreign camerawoman and sound engineer, said, "I did not know what I would encounter."
“They did not know Turkish either.” he says.
Young Wrestlers focuses on the stories of six of the 26 young wrestlers.

Baran, who was raised by his grandfather and has a weight problem, Harun, who cannot attend the training because he broke his arm, Beytullah, who is ambitious but has health problems, Ümit, the sweetest kid at school, the youngest champion, Ahmet and Muhammed, who keeps the group together...
Mete Gümürhan explains his work with children as follows: "I let them be completely natural."
I just tried to use Muhammad everywhere.
I made the shoot in the training during the first week and a half.
My wish was for the children to act as if there were no camera.
"Luckily, they got used to it quickly."
Berlin was chosen as a surprise
Mete Gümürhan says he did not expect Young Wrestlers to be selected for the Berlinale, "we were prepared but it was a surprise to be selected for Berlin."
Young Wrestlers is not a sports documentary, but rather a work that tells the struggles of children and shares their lives.
"I wanted to focus on the stories of kids who have identity problems and their efforts to get rid of them," he says.

I'm your fan, please help!
Hürrem Sultan's red hair, Beren's nose, Justin's hair...
Becoming like the famous to a certain extent is considered normal, but when it starts to affect your life in its entirety, it is considered to be a psychological disorder.
`Celebrity worship syndrome`, also known as 'worshiping the celebrity syndrome', is a topic that has already become an academic subject in the world, but recently starting to be discussed in Turkey.
It's not so unusual for ladies to run to the hairdressers with pictures of celebrities.
But do not forget the year of Hurrem Sultan, when all teenagers were moving around with red hair.
It is already known that the 'Beren burnu' led the aesthetic operations in the year 2015 that is left behind.
The situation is not very different in the men's section either.
In a period, it was a custom to dress like Polat Alemdar.
Now a wind is blowing that is quite the opposite.
Our environment is filled with Justin Bieber copies.

So much so that the following unnecessary information that we are quoting has been read thousands of times on the internet: "When you go to the barber, have your hair cut from the sides, i.e. the upper ear and area, towards the top of your head."
They will be short-lived loners.
After the trimming process, you should shape the hair with a little water.
After the shaping is done, set the hair by spraying with spray.
"You have to style it when it's wet to achieve Justin's look."

All of these bring to mind the 'Celebrity worship syndrome', which is a topic that is already discussed in academic circles around the world, but that is only now beginning to be talked about in Turkey.
Fans of celebrities are seen as bunches of love in our country.
The artists boast about their fan numbers and how much they have been affected by the artists.
Fortunately, psychology does not see the situation so simply.
The fact that teenagers decide what to eat, what to listen to, what to wear based on the celebrities' likes is being debated.
Being overly attached to celebrities that are presented as out of reach is defined as a psychological disorder.
Expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir accepts that Turkey is lagging behind in its work in this field.

Yet, he does not miss to see that the families are starting to get aware: "One of the main issues of psychology science is about people to be in peace with themselves and to find peace within their own identity."
Previously, filling a child's room with posters and dressing up as one of these people was something that was not taken seriously at all.
That is changing now.
The parent feels the need to step in.
"Passionate commitment to someone is a sign that something has gone wrong in a young person's life."
Fans who boarded the emotional speed train
Interest in celebrities is safe as long as it does not go to extremes.
Demir suggests paying attention to signs like not wanting to get married, jealousy towards one's partner or choosing one's clothes.
We are talking about celebrities, as their names suggest.
To be curious about them, to be interested in their lives is considered normal to a certain degree.

But according to the specialist psychologist, the young people who lose the top of the scale are in the majority: "When there are no names in the family or surroundings that represent the child in terms of virtue and good behavior, that gap is certainly filled."
Not all of them turn out to be good examples.
"The child copies negative behaviors as well."
When I asked how to approach them, Sümeyye Demir, who reminds me that fanatical syndrome is seen mostly in adolescence, starts talking.
When you consider that teenagers may be insecure, the problem becomes easier to overcome.

On the one hand, we have teenagers who complain about their parents’ limitations, while on the other hand they expect support and affection: “We must take into consideration their emotional ups and downs.”
New research shows that they have difficulties because of the changes that happen in their brains.
The love of one of the youngsters who gets on the train of emotions is also natural and should be approached softly.
It is possible to change our behaviors
The psychologist Sümeyye Demir, reminds us of the duties of the parents to get past the adulation of celebrities:
Recognize his emotional distress, be sure you're calm before you intervene.
Never allow her to suppress her feelings.
Make sure to express your admiration for his independence.
Instead of scolding them, set a good example for them, discuss about people who are role models for her.
Try to discuss the role of the celebrities in our daily lives.
Reading books that tell about the real world of celebrities will be helpful.
Be sure to change your communication to an adult-to-adult style.
Do not forget that addiction and motivation both use the same pathways in the brain.
Share with your child that mistakes are opportunities for change and accept him as he is.
Be sure to get expert help on the subject of fandom.
The jealous and the infuriated admire it too.
At the root of the worship of celebrities is the need to seek help and assistance from others.
Unstoppable love is actually a call for help.
But unfortunately, it is not perceived this way.
Moreover, the problem is so widespread that it is impossible to confine it to one country or continent.
Dr. Recai Yahyaoglu points out that there are some specific names that keep the television busy in every country.
The syndrome is more connected to attaching oneself to these famous people: "They are extraordinary."
The majority of them do not have the means.

Those who own them, however, do not act as though they do.
```
Because they do not adopt it or do not have the courage to do so.
"But, those who can't [live like that] or those who can but can't live like them, are watching with envy."
The envious or pissed-off viewers are actually the same.
Both of them feed a secret Admiration.
They earn money effortlessly, they are in the agenda of the magazines.
Just knowing that is enough to increase the fan base.
Another advice of Expert Psychologist Sümeyye Demir is at this point to question the reality of those lives.
Artificial lives should not be overlooked.
Here is where the support of the circle of the person who craves fame comes into play.
However, the fan cannot accept the fact that their favorite celebrity also has problems like they do.
